newsitem.title: USA: IMM currency futures mostly lower in early trade.
newsitem.headline: IMM currency futures mostly lower in early trade.

text.p: IMM currency futures were lower, except sterling which continued to rally due to activity in the cash crosses, traders and forex analysts said.
They said an unwinding of short sterling/long mark positions lifted September sterling to $1.6520 in early pit trade. Resistance is at the four-week high of $1.6550.
"There is the propensity for every country outside of Continental Europe to do well," Dennis Gartman, editor and publisher of The Gartman Letter, said.
September marks and Swiss francs fell quietly as traders covered short dollar positions ahead of the G7 meeting.
